text: Dorothy Jean Dandridge (November 9, 1922 â€“ September 8, 1965) was an African American singer and actress. In 1955, she became the first black actress to be nominated for an Academy Award.Earl Mills, Dorothy Dandridge: An Intimate Biography (Los Angeles: Holloway House, 1999), p. 13 The nomination was for Best Actress. She starred in many movies. Dandridge was born in Cleveland, Ohio.Louie Robinson, 'Dorthy Dandridge; Hollywood's Tragic Enigma', Ebony Magazine, Vol XXI, No. 5 (March 1966), p. 74 She died of a drug overdose in Los Angeles, California.Earl Mills, Dorothy Dandridge: An Intimate Biography (Los Angeles: Holloway House, 1999), p. 199 == References == Category:1922 births Category:1965 deaths Category:American movie actors Category:Actors from Cleveland Category:Musicians from Ohio Category:Drug-related accidental deaths in the United States
title: Dorothy Dandridge
